1.brief: properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to end (in the sense of completion or failure)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

2.brief: evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, smoothness; figuratively, flattery; also an allotment
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

3.brief: to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, smoothness; figuratively, flattery; also an allotment
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent

4.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
to be strong; by implication, to prevail, act insolently
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

5.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to place (in a very wide application)
to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff

6.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively)
probably a crucible (as working over the metal)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

7.brief: thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

8.brief: (as noun) a circle, neighbour, or environs; but chiefly (as adverb, with or without preposition) around
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
properly, a shaking, i.e. perhaps a tempest
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
